episode_event_specialcos02_ch0259_40_san:
Before the tea party, Sonia invited Nessa to have
a Pokémon battle.

I was hoping a battle would be a
nice distraction...

You did seem pretty preoccupied by all the tea
party preparation you’ve been doing.

I’ve got the tea, treats, and puzzles all
prepared, but...
I’m just worried that I might be missing something.

Let’s put the battle aside for a moment and take
a break.
Good idea... Oh! I’ll make us some tea!

The three brothers from Striaton City in Unova
taught me how to make the tastiest tea.
Oh, now I’m really looking forward to it!

So, if you’re making the tea for us, I’ll come up
with a riddle!

It might help you come up with more puzzle ideas
for the tea party.
Oh, sounds fun! I’m game!
Then here’s my riddle for you, Sonia!

To make the finest tea, you need three things.
And those are...?

Huh? That’s way too easy! I was just
taught that, remember?
They told me...
I, Cilan, select only the best tea leaves...
I, Cress, prepare the purest water...

And I, Chili, pour the water after heating it to just
the perfect temperature!

We believe that the tea we make this way is the
best in all of Unova... No, in the whole world!
Tea leaves, water, and the perfect heat...

You think you know the answer? Well then, let’s
hear it!

To make the finest tea, you need three things,
which correspond with certain “types.”

What are those three types? Make a team with
them, and bring it to me as your answer!

The answer is Grass, Water, and Fire! Those three
types, right?
Correct! Well done, Sonia!

I also get along well with Kabu and Milo. Maybe
these three types just make a good combination?
Hee hee, you might be on to something!

OK, I’ve prepared the finest tea! Let’s savor
it together!
Yes, please!

This takes me back... Remember how you used to
make curry when we were adventuring together
back in the day?

You never quite made it to Charizard class, but for
some reason, I’ll never forget that flavor.

Do you think maybe there’s actually a fourth thing
you need to make the finest tea?
Tea leaves, water, heat, and...one more?
Yes! A dash of love!

After all, you were thinking of me when you made
me that curry, right?

I think making tea involves more than skill, too.
Maybe it’s important to be thinking about the
person you’re making it for.
Yes, that’s exactly it! You’ve figured it out, Nessa!

No matter how much I prepare, if I don’t really
put my heart into it, I can’t possibly be a
good hostess!

Thanks for helping me realize that! That nagging
feeling in my mind is finally gone!

It really is great to have friends like you!
Ohohoho!
Yeah... But what’s up with that laugh?
I’m rehearsing so I can really get into my role!

I’ve dressed up like a queen to go perfectly with
Tsareena and really entertain everyone at the
tea party!

You do always put your all into everything you do,
Sonia. Good luck with the party!
